PROFESSOR: A lot of what we
have done, until today, we

sort of assumed, at one place
or another, that the people

left part of the curve.

This could be removed if you

So it seems that we needed to
spend some time discussing.

We can't really take

So as the bank tried to expand

expand in rural areas.

And moreover, to this day, banks
were given rules about

how their portfolio needed

priority sector rule, saying

The priority sector is
small enterprises in the rural sector. And within priority sector,

portfolio this way and capping

they could charge.

It had the result that loans
were pushed to farmers and things like that.
